alert.note: Alert for Sussex; Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 7:49AM EST until January 11 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern New Jersey, including the following counties, Sussex and Warren. * WHEN...Until noon EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 748 AM EST, flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen overnight. - For Paulins Kill at Blairstown: At 7:30am the stage was 4.92 feet. Flood Stage is 5 feet. ... For Pequest River at Huntsville: At 7:30am the stage was 4.08 feet. Flood Stage is 4 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
